title: Tuna Taters
summary: Tuna Taters requires approximately 24 minutes from start to finish. Watching your figure? This gluten free and pescatarian recipe has 730 calories, 66g of protein, and 17g of fat per serving. For $2.37 per serving, this recipe covers 45% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 1. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up tuna, broccoli, chili powder, and a few other things to make it today. Not a lot of people really liked this main course. It is brought to you by recipes.prevention.com. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 91%. This score is super. Similar recipes include Taco Taters, Parmesan Taters, and Mashed Taters.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. You could try Enate Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Enate Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot
productMatches.description: Fully ruby color. A complex blackcurrant, blackberry aroma with a touch of violet and hints of red pepper, vanilla and herbs. Smooth and round mouthfeel; the soft tannic cushion gives way to a flavorsome palate which releases pleasant honey-roast aromas. The well-balanced acidity will ensure improvement in the bottle over the next five years.
